Introduction to C

A short overview and a minimal example program.

What is C?

C is a general-purpose, compiled systems programming language. It provides low-level access to memory, a small runtime, and a simple but powerful syntax. C programs are typically compiled with a compiler such as gcc.

Minimal example

Save this as hello.c, compile and run:

// hello.c - a minimal C program
    #include <stdio.h>

    int main(void) {
        /* print a message to standard output */
        printf("Hello, world!\n");
        return 0;
    }

Compile and run:

gcc -o hello hello.c
    ./hello

Tips: functions are declared with return types, main is the program entry point, and headers like <stdio.h> provide library declarations such as printf.
